alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 1:37AM CDT until July 07 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of panhandle Nebraska, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 345 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... White Clay, Mount Maria, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Pine Ridge and Metcalf State Wildlife Management Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
